result.execSummary:
The defendant TYLER J. LUKASAVAGE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office.  Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  CLERK OF COURTS - PO BOX 2808 - ROOM 110 - OSHKOSH WI  54903.

ON EACH COUNT CONCURRENT AND CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE - Huber/GPS granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant currently in custody at the Winnebago County Jail.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, please call 920-236-4906 to arrange an appointment with Winnebago County Sheriff located at the Winnebago County Courthouse: Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

10:30 AM Defendant TYLER J. LUKASAVAGE in court with attorney Daniel Mark Muza.  Defendant TYLER J. LUKASAVAGE in custody.  Nerrissa L Dyett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  DE requests bond reduction to signature bond.  The State objects.  The Court will not amend bond.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 10:48.  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
